subEntries.title: milRapixoCXP
subEntries.text: Matrox Imaging Library (MIL) X Update 131 Matrox Rapixo CXP release notes July 2023  (c) Copyright Matrox Electronic Systems Ltd., 1992-2023.   This document outlines what is new with the MIL X driver for Matrox Rapixo CXP and explains the current limitations and particularities.   It also presents last-minute information that did not make it into the manual or on-line help. Note that this document serves to complement your manual. The information found in this document overrides your formally documented material. Contents 1.     MIL X Driver for Matrox Rapixo CXP 1.1         What?s new in MIL X Update 131 1.1.1      Standards compliance 1.1.2      Summary of new features 1.1.3????? Gecho Viewer 1.1.4      Software bug fixes and changes 1.1.5      Firmware bug fixes and changes 1.2         What?s new in MIL X Update 118 1.2.1      Standards compliance 1.2.2      Summary of new features 1.2.3      Software bug fixes and changes 1.2.4      Firmware bug fixes and changes 1.2.5      Known issues 1.3         What?s new in MIL X Update 100 1.3.1      Standards compliance 1.3.2      Summary of new features 1.3.3      Matrox Capture Works 1.3.4      New Matrox Gecho logging tool 1.3.5      New Matrox Slave Mode Dcf Maker tool for Matrox Rapixo DF (Data Forwarding) 1.3.6      Software bug fixes and changes 1.3.7      Firmware bug fixes and changes 1.4         What?s new in MIL 10 Update 87 1.4.1      Standards compliance 1.4.2      Summary of new features 1.4.3      API enhancements to control trigger (M_GRAB_TRIGGER_ACTIVATION) 1.4.4      API enhancements to timer controls 1.4.5      New API to inquire the CXP connection topology 1.4.6      New API to use CXP test mode 1.4.7      Software bug fixes and changes 1.4.8      Known limitations and particularities 1.5         What?s new in MIL 10 Update 84 1.5.1      Standards compliance 1.5.2      Summary of new features 1.5.3      API enhancements to control Power over CXP (PoCXP) 1.5.4      API enhancements to monitor CXP link errors 1.5.5      Mfpga API enhancements 1.5.6      Software bug fixes and changes 1.6         What?s new in MIL 10 Update 75 1.6.1      Standards compliance 1.6.2      Known limitations and particularities 2.     Supported operating system 3.     Location of examples (in the help file)   1.     MIL X Driver for Matrox Rapixo CXP 1.1???? What?s new in MIL X Update 131   MIL X Update 131 requires MIL X Service Pack 6 (SP6). Moreover, this update was validated using MIL(-Lite) X Version 22H1.  1.1.1??? Standards compliance Matrox Rapixo CXP supports the following standards: ?         JIIA CoaXPress? Standard version 2.0 ?         GenICam? GenApi version 3.4.0 ?         GenICamTM Standard Feature Naming Convention (SFNC) version 2.7 ?         GenICamTM  GenTL version 1.6 1.1.2        Summary of new features   ?         New Gecho Viewer utility. ?         Support for Matrox Rapixo CXP Quad CXP-6 PCIe 3.1 x4. ?         Improved digitizer allocation speed. ?         Support for updating firmware without power cycling the system. ?         Support for CXP 2.0 triggers in MdigControl with M_LINK_TRIGGER_n_OUT  and M_LINK_TRIGGER_n_IN.   1.1.2.1????? Additions to MdigControl() / MdigInquire():   M_TIMER_ARM_SOFTWARE + M_TIMERn Issues a software trigger to arm the timer. To use this setting, the timer's arm source must be set to software (M_TIMER_ARM_SOURCE set to M_SOFTWARE).   ?M_ACTIVATE Specifies that timer arming is enabled.   M_IO_FORMAT + Sets/Inquires the type of transmitter/receiver for the specified I/O signal.   ?M_LINK_SIGNAL Specifies to use the transport layer link triggers as the specified I/O signal. M_IO_INTERRUPT_ACTIVATION + Sets/Inquires the signal transition upon which to generate an interrupt. M_IO_MODE + Sets/Inquires the mode of the specified I/O signal. M_IO_SOURCE + Sets/Inquires the signal to route to an output signal, or a bidirectional signal set to output mode. M_LINK_TRIGGER_n_IN Specifies to route the link trigger input signal n to the output signal. M_IO_STATUS + Specifies to inquire the status of the input signal or bidirectional signal set to input.   For specifying the type and number of the I/O signal to affect M_LINK_TRIGGER_n_IN Specifies to affect the link trigger input signal n (from the camera), where n is the number of the link trigger input signal. Note that this value is only available when using M_IO_FORMAT, M_IO_INTERRUPT_ACTIVATION, M_IO_MODE, and M_IO_STATUS. M_LINK_TRIGGER_n_OUT Specifies to affect the link trigger output signal n (to the camera), where n is the number of the link trigger output signal. Note that this value is only available when using M_IO_FORMAT, M_IO_SOURCE, M_IO_MODE, and M_IO_STATUS.   1.1.3??? Gecho Viewer   Gecho Viewer is an application used to control and display event logging information gathered by Gecho. To access Gecho Viewer, launch the MILConfig utility.? Then, expand the Boards item in the tree structure, navigate to Rapixo series, then CXP. Gecho Viewer will be visible in the Launch External Applications page. It can also be found in the ../Matrox Imaging/Tools/GechoViewer folder. The Gecho Viewer User Guide can also be found in this folder.   ?         Visualize with high precision hardware events received and generated by the frame grabber: o   AuxIO changes; o   Timers; o   CXP triggers; o   CXP protocol and connection errors; o   Grabbing events. ?         Visualize software events: o   Camera and digitizer communication; o   Grab and Hook events; o   Errors and Warnings like disconnection or missed frames. ?         Includes Example Traces (logging samples): o   Camera disconnects; o   Frames missed by hardware overtriggering; o   Frames missed by software latency. 1.1.4??? Software bug fixes and changes ?         Fixed known issue in Update 118 when changing the format of a camera in Capture Works not being applied to the display (such as, pixel format, width, or height). ?         Fixed possible memory corruption issue when using a camera with a height bigger than 12k.  ?         Fixed a time out that could occur when calling MdigProcess(M_STOP) when the camera invalided features while stopping. ?         Fixed possible grab corruption that could occur on digitizer M_DEV1 or higher when host system experiences long interrupt latency. ?         Fixed possible system crash that could occur when using MsysControl(M_MODIFIED_BUFFER_HOOK_MODE, M_MULTI_THREAD). ?         Fixed issue where MdigControl(M_IO_DEBOUNCE_TIME) was producing an error on digitizer M_DEV1 or higher. ?         Fixed system compatibility issue that could occur on systems that mapped the board over 4 GB system memory space.  ?         Fixed issue where MdigAlloc returned an allocation error when using a camera where the frame size was near a third of the on-board memory size. ?         Fixed issue to ensure proper initial timer settings.  ?         Fixed issue where the power regulator was not properly programmed. ?         Fixed issue where MdigControl(M_IO_INTERRUPT_STATE, M_DISABLE) did not disable the interrupt generation. ?         Fixed issue when subsampling a grab with M_GRAB_SCALE_Y from a Bayer camera. ?         Fixed issue with small artifact occurring in the image when grabbing from a Bayer camera.  ?         Improved firmware updating on multiple boards. ?         Improved system boot time when booting with multiple boards on some specific systems.  ?         Improved efficiency of MdigGrab/MdigProcess when grabbing at high frame rates. ?         Improved robustness with cameras that are not PFNC-compliant with the RegionSelector.  ?         Improved error reporting when changing camera size and not having enough memory to allocate internal buffers. ?         Support for modifying the receiver gain for a Matrox Rapixo CXP Data Forwarding. 1.1.5??? Firmware bug fixes and changes ?         Added support for a pulse multiplier.  ?         Added support for hardware event logs.  ?         Added support for distinct output of M_LINK_TRIGGER_n_OUT. ?         Added support for updating firmware without power-cycling. ?         Fixed issue for the voltage alarm for Matrox Rapixo CXP Single and Dual.  ?         Fixed rare issue when programming the FPGA at driver start.  ?         Fixed bug in the M_GRAB_FRAME_BURST_END_TRIGGER functionality. ?         Fixed issue with IDLE character not being sent on high trigger rates that may cause some cameras to unlock.  ?         Fixed issue with CXP test packet.  ?         Fixed issue with high line rate camera (+400KHz) causing grab corruption and overrun.  ?         Fixed issue with a frame retrigger in a line scan application.  ?         Fixed issue seen with a specific camera that was sending very small packets.  ?         Fixed issue with vertical subsampling when grabbing Bayer images.  ?         Fixed issue when using multiple DATA_LATCH while doing Host reads to local memory.  1.2???????? What?s new in MIL X Update 118   MIL X Update 118 requires MIL X Service Pack 5 (SP5). Moreover, this update was validated using MIL(-Lite) X Version 1911 bis and Version 2102. 1.2.1??????? Standards compliance   Matrox Rapixo CXP supports the following standards: ?         JIIA CoaXPress?  Standard version 2.0 ?         GenICam? GenApi version 3.3.0 ?         GenICamTM Standard Feature Naming Convention (SFNC) version 2.6 ?         GenICamTM  GenTL version 1.6 1.2.2        Summary of new features   ?         Added support for Multi-Stream cameras: o   Up to a maximum of 9 streams are available for one camera. When using more than one camera, there must be at least one stream per camera. The number of remaining streams are then available to be distributed among the cameras. o   Automatically supported in Matrox Capture Works. o   Refer to MIL example MultiComponentGrab to see how to use a Multi-Stream camera with MIL containers. ?         Added support for TapGeometry cameras. o   All standard CXP tap geometries are supported including 1X-2YE. ?         Added support of grabbing into paged buffers (with the M_PAGED attribute). o   By default M_GRAB buffers are allocated in non-paged memory. If the non-paged memory is set to 0, then the default becomes paged memory. ?         Added support for MdigControl(M_IO_DEBOUNCE_TIME + M_AUX_IOn) to set the amount of time that an auxiliary input signal is debounced. o   Can be set on a maximum of 4 inputs. o   Value is in ns from 0 to 8300000ns (8.3ms). ?         Matrox Gecho logging tool improvements: o   Added a new log file format that can be analysed interactively using the Google Perfetto tool (https://perfetto.dev/). o   Added ?sentry? and ?sentryonly? modes that only log when an error, warning, or a specific message is detected. This is useful in a factory environment where you do not want excessively large log files. o   Run Gecho --help for additional information. o   The Matrox Gecho tool is located in the ...\Matrox Imaging\Tools folder. ?         Matrox Capture Works improvements: o   Added support for ?File Access? to be able to exchange files with a camera. o   Miscellaneous user-interface improvements and bug fixes. ?         Matrox FPGA Development Kit (FDK) improvements: o   Added support for dmard_sub6 and AXI4-Stream Broadcaster. o   Fixed issue when an IP with a large number of stream ports is used.   1.2.3        Software bug fixes and changes   ?         Fixed support of RGB cameras with GenICamTM GenTL producer. ?         Fixed M_USER_BIT_TL_TRIGGER compatibility issue introduced with Update 100 when using Matrox Design Assistant version 6 or 7. ?         Improved digitizer allocation speed. ?         Improved detection of live unplug for CXP cameras. 1.2.4        Firmware bug fixes and changes   ?         Added support for Multi-Stream cameras. ?         Added support for scatter-gather DMA transfers. ?         Added support for auxiliary IO debouncing. ?         PCIe BAR2 is now prefetchable. ?         Improvements in the Power-Over-CXP logic. ?         Fixed issue with Timer Trigger Missed. ?         Fixed tolerance on Vccint and Vccaux system monitoring. ?         PCIe requests to BAR0 with length > 8 bytes are now handled as ?Completer Abort?. 1.2.5        Known issues   ?         In Matrox Capture Works when changing the format of a camera (such as, pixel format, width, or height), those changes are not applied to the display. To be able to view the applied settings on the display you must reallocate the camera.   1.3         What?s new in MIL X Update 100   MIL X Update 100 requires MIL X Service Pack 4 (SP4). 1.3.1        Standards compliance Matrox Rapixo CXP supports the following standards: ?         JIIA CoaXPress?  Standard version 2.0, 1.1.1 and 1.0 ?         GenICam? GenApi version 3.2.0 ?         GenICamTM Standard Feature Naming Convention (SFNC) version 2.5 ?         GenICamTM  GenTL version 1.5 1.3.2        Summary of new features ?         Support for Matrox Rapixo CXP DF (Data Forwarding). ?         New Matrox Capture Works utility to replace Matrox Intellicam. ?         New Matrox Gecho utility to log trace messages generated by Matrox Rapixo CXP. ?         Added support for MsysControl/Inquire (M_DISCOVER_DEVICE) to report connected cameras. ?         Added support for MsysHook (M_CAMERA_PRESENT) to notify when a camera is disconnected. ?         New Slave DCF maker tool for Matrox Rapixo CXP DF.   1.3.3        Matrox Capture Works   Matrox Capture Works is a new interactive utility to configure and test devices that use a GenICam-based interface standard. Matrox Capture Works will ultimately replace Matrox Intellicam and is available for Windows and will also be available for Linux.   Matrox Capture Works key features: ?         Camera centric UI with support for camera enumeration and presence. ?         Feature browser to display and control camera, digitizer, and system settings. ?         DCF creation to save camera and digitizer settings. ?         Efficient display of grabbed images with many options and view modes. ?         Display of line and arc profiles. ?         Display of image histogram. ?         Memory viewer to display pixel values.   1.3.4        New Matrox Gecho logging tool   Matrox Gecho is a tool that logs events generated by the camera and the frame grabber.   You can run Matrox Gecho concurrently with your MIL application to help detect and diagnose grabbing errors such as: ?         Over trigger conditions. ?         CXP link errors. ?         Unexpected camera removal. ?         Latency issues.   The log file is saved in a semicolon separated format and it can be loaded with any CSV viewer like Microsoft Excel.   The Matrox Gecho tool is located in the ...\Matrox Imaging\Tools folder.   1.3.5        New Matrox Slave Mode Dcf Maker tool for Matrox Rapixo DF (Data Forwarding)   This tool creates a slave-mode DCF file that stores the connection details and feature settings of a CoaXpress camera connected to a Matrox Rapixo CXP or Matrox Radient CXP. A slave-mode DCF can only be used with slave Matrox CXP boards connected to a master Matrox Rapixo CXP DF. 1.3.6        Software bug fixes and changes ?         Added ability to change the timer duration while a grab is in progress. ?         Added new DCF ?CoaxPress_currentstate.dcf?, which can be used with line-scan and frame-scan cameras. ?         Added support for buffer allocation in NUMA memory banks (M_MEMORY_BANKn). ?         Now using Message-Signaled Interrupts (MSI) instead of line-based interrupts. ?         Fixed minor issue with MdigInquire(M_CONNECTION_STATE). ?         Fixed issue with cameras that do not properly support SFNC pixel format, in which case we use the PFNC value. ?         Fixed issue when setting M_GRAB_FRAME_BURST_MAX_TIME to M_DEFAULT. ?         Fixed issue when performing a Bayer operation with a child source buffer. ?         Fixed issue when performing resends of CXP write commands. ?         MPD (Multi-Peak Detect): Minor fixes related to fixed point precision and size of the result array. ?         Added documentation for the following features: o   MsysHookFunction (M_CAMERA_PRESENT) and MsysGetHookInfo (M_CAMERA_PRESENT) o   MdigGetHookInfo (M_GRAB_LINE_END) o   MdigGetHookInfo (M_GC_FEATURE_CHANGE_NAME) o   MdigInquire: o   M_CAMERA_PRESENT o   M_CAMERA_MODEL o   M_GC_VERSION o   M_GC_SERIAL_NUMBER o   M_GC_USER_NAME o   MdigControl / MdigInquire: o   M_TIMER_RESET_SOURCE o   M_TIMER_ARM o   M_TIMER_ARM_SOURCE o   M_TIMER_ARM_ACTIVATION o   M_CONNECTION_... o   M_CONNECTION_TEST_... o   MsysControl / MsysInquire: o   M_TL_ERROR_...   1.3.7        Firmware bug fixes and changes ?         Increased DMA addressing to 48 bits. ?         Improved M_GRAB_ABORT to recover from camera over trigger situations. ?         Fixed issue when grabbing images with a width smaller then 28 bytes. ?         Fixed issue when receiving camera trigger acknowledge packets which could lead to grab errors. ?         Fixed possibility of data corruption with 10/12 bit LUTs. ?         Fixed issue with horizontal image flip. ?         Fixed issue when grabbing dark images which could lead to grab errors. ?         Fixed inverted pixels issue with KU60. 1.4         What?s new in MIL 10 Update 87 1.4.1        Standards compliance Matrox Rapixo CXP supports the following standards: ?         JIIA CoaXPress? Standard version 2.0, 1.1.1 and 1.0 ?         GenICam? GenApi version 3.1.0 ?         GenICamTM Standard Feature Naming Convention (SFNC) version 2.5 ?         GenICamTM  GenTL version 1.5 1.4.2        Summary of new features The following features are new for this release: ?         Added support for Matrox Rapixo CXP Single/Dual. ?         Added support for Matrox FPGA Development Kit (FDK) version 19.1.10 and later. ?         Added support for CXP device tap geometry. ?         Added new API to inquire CXP connection topology (see M_CONNECTION below) ?         Added new API to use CXP test mode. ?         Added new MdigControls of M_TIMER_ARM. ?         Added new MdigControls of M_TIMER_RESET_SOURCE.   1.4.3        API enhancements to control trigger (M_GRAB_TRIGGER_ACTIVATION) MdigControl / MdigInquire Control Value Description M_GRAB_TRIGGER_ACTIVATION                                               M_LEVEL_LOW_END_WHEN_INACTIVE Specifies that triggered grabs are initiated by a low trigger signal polarity and completed when the trigger signal goes high. M_LEVEL_HIGH_END_WHEN_INACTIVE Specifies that triggered grabs are initiated by a high trigger signal polarity and completed when the trigger signal goes low.   1.4.4        API enhancements to timer controls   MdigControl / MdigInquire Control Value Description M_TIMER_RESET_SOURCE + M_TIMERn                                                 Same values as existing for M_TIMER_TRIGGER_SOURCE (see MdigControl reference) Specifies how the timer reset is triggered (for example, by an auxiliary input signal or after a specified period of time).   Resetting the timer sets it to 0 and immediately restarts the clock. M_TIMER_ARM + M_TIMERn M_ENABLE M_DISABLE M_DEFAULT (value from DCF    or M_DISABLE) Specifies whether to enable the timer arming mechanism. If timer arming is enabled, then the timer will ignore its trigger signal until a signal transition specified using M_TIMER_ARM_ACTIVATION occurs on the signal specified using M_TIMER_ARM_SOURCE. M_TIMER_ARM_SOURCE + M_TIMERn Same values as M_TIMER_TRIGGER_SOURCE Specifies which input source will arm the timer, if timer arming is enabled. Use M_TIMER_ARM to enable timer arming. M_TIMER_ARM_ACTIVATION + M_TIMERn M_LEVEL_LOW M_LEVEL_HIGH M_EDGE_RISING M_EDGE_FALLING M_DEFAULT (value from DCF or M_EDGE_RISING) Specifies which state, or transition, of the signal from the input source will arm the timer, if timer arming is enabled. Use M_TIMER_ARM to enable timer arming.   1.4.5        New API to inquire the CXP connection topology   MdigControl / MdigInquire Control Value Description M_CONNECTION_COUNT                                               MIL_INT Specifies the number of connections between the system and the camera M_CONNECTION_STATE +  M_CONNECTIONn M_DETECTED M_UNDETECTED Specifies the state of the connection. M_CONNECTION_TYPE + M_CONNECTIONn M_MASTER M_SLAVE  Specifies the CXP connection type. Typically, a camera only has one master connection. M_CONNECTION_ID +  M_CONNECTIONn MIL_INT Specifies which physical CXP connector on the camera is connected to CXP connector n on your board (for example, CXP connector 3 might be connected to CXP connector 1 on your camera, in which case this inquiry will return 1).   1.4.6        New API to use CXP test mode     MdigControl/MdigInquire Control Value and Type Description M_CONNECTION_TEST_MODE +  M_CONNECTIONn M_OFF M_MODE1 Use to enable or disable the CXP test mode. M_CONNECTION_TEST_ERROR_COUNT +  M_CONNECTIONn MIL_INT64 Returns the current connection error count for test packets. Can be set to 0 to reset counter. M_CONNECTION_TEST_PACKET_TRANSMITTED_COUNT +  M_CONNECTIONn MIL_INT64 Return the number of test packet transmitted. Can be set to 0 to reset counter. M_CONNECTION_TEST_PACKET_RECEIVED_COUNT  + M_CONNECTIONn MIL_INT64 Return the number of test packet received. Can be set to 0 to reset counter.   1.4.7        Software bug fixes and changes ?         Improved camera detection reliability and speed. ?         Added support for grabbing from 14-bit monochrome and Bayer cameras. o   The Bayer conversion hardware supports a maximum line width of 16KB on Rapixo CXP-6 models and 32KB on Rapixo CXP-12 models. ?         Improve error messages when settings digitizer LUTs. ?         Fixed possible crash when freeing the digitizer while the feature browser is open. ?         Fixed possible crash when using DataLatches while grabbing on-board. ?         Fixed issue when using CXP trigger from camera. ?         Fixed issues with GenTL Producer related to camera discovery and camera vendor/model name reporting. ?         Increased default time period from PoCXP voltage application where over-current condition is ignored, from 256ms to 512ms. o   At the initial period following PoCXP application, the voltage may induce a punctual over-current due to the initial in-rush current (to charge the line capacitance), which may be followed by secondary over-currents caused by the activation of a camera?s power-supplies. 1.4.8        Known limitations and particularities ?         For the Matrox Rapixo CXP Single/Dual, the system board type shown in the Feature Browser is incorrect and results in an error message that can be ignored. 1.5         What?s new in MIL 10 Update 84 1.5.1        Standards compliance Matrox Rapixo CXP supports the following standards: ?         JIIA CoaXPress? Standard version 1.0 and 1.1.1 ?         GenICam? GenApi version 3.1.0 ?         GenICamTM Standard Feature Naming Convention (SFNC) version 2.5 ?         GenICamTM  GenTL version 1.5 1.5.2        Summary of new features ?         This is the first release that supports the Matrox FPGA Development Kit (FDK) for the Matrox Rapixo CXP Pro, which is available in a separate installation package. ?         A new tool has been added in MILConfig to display board information and details of the PUs (processing units) and TUs (transfer units) implemented, with the Matrox FDK, in the firmware for a Matrox Rapixo CXP Pro. The Board Information utility can be found in MILConfig, under Boards / Rapixo CXP. ?         Added support of GenICamTM GenTL Producer with support for Data Stream and Buffer modules. ?         Improved digitizer allocation speed. 1.5.3        API enhancements to control Power over CXP (PoCXP) MsysControl / MsysInquire Control Value Description M_POWER_OVER_CABLE + M_CONNECTIONn / M_ALL (n is the CXP port number from 0 to 3) M_TU_NAME + n M_TU_FID + n M_ON Specifies to force power on the port. M_OFF Specifies to disable power on the port. M_AUTOMATIC Activates auto detection of PoCXP cameras. M_RESET Resets an error condition (over or under current) on the PoCXP port. M_DEFAULT Same as M_AUTOMATIC.   MsysInquire Inquired Value Description M_POWER_OVER_CABLE_STATUS + M_CONNECTIONn (n is the CXP port number from 0 to 3)M_TU_FID + n M_ON Power is currently sent to the camera. M_OFF No power is sent to the camera. M_SENSE Currently sensing for a PoCXP camera. M_OVER_CURRENT An over-current error condition was detected; power is disabled. To restore power, use MsysControl (?, M_POWER_OVER_CABLE + M_CONNECTIONn, M_RESET). M_UNDER_CURRNET An under-current error condition was detected; power is disabled. To restore power, use MsysControl (?, M_POWER_OVER_CABLE + M_CONNECTIONn, M_RESET).   1.5.4        API enhancements to monitor CXP link errors   MsysControl / MsysInquire Type Description M_TL_ERROR_LOCK_LOSS_COUNT + MIL_INT64 Returns the number of loss of lock. To reset this error, set this control to 0. M_TL_ERROR_CORRECTED_COUNT + MIL_INT64 Returns the number of corrected errors in the duplicated characters in CXP control words. To reset this error, set this control to 0. M_TL_ERROR_UNCORRECTED_COUNT + MIL_INT64 Returns the number of uncorrected errors in the duplicated characters in CXP control words. To reset this error, set this control to 0. M_TL_ERROR_DATA_CRC_COUNT + MIL_INT64 Returns the number of CRC errors detected in a data packet. To reset this error, set this control to 0. M_TL_ERROR_CTRL_CRC_COUNT + MIL_INT64 Returns the number of CRC errors detected in a control packet. To reset this error, set this control to 0. M_TL_ERROR_EVENT_CRC_COUNT + MIL_INT64 Returns the number of CRC errors detected in an event packet. To reset this error, set this control to 0. M_TL_ERROR_ENCODING_COUNT + MIL_INT64 Returns the number of protocol encoding errors detected. To reset this error, set this control to 0. M_TL_ERROR_COUNT + MIL_INT64 Returns the sum of all error counters. Setting this control to 0 resets all of the above errors.   The combination values for all M_TL_ERROR_* controls can be M_CONNECTIONn (n is the CXP port number from 0 to 3) or M_ALL for an aggregation of all the ports.   1.5.5        Mfpga API enhancements ?         MfpgaSetDestination: changed the returned value from void to MIL_INT. It now returns the stream route number to be programmed in the PU to reach the specified destination.   Additions to MfpgaInquire and MfpgaCommandInquire:   MfpgaInquire Type Description M_PU_NAME + n MIL_STRING Used with M_NUMBER_OF_PU to get the name of the PU at index n. M_PU_FID + n MIL_INT Returns the function ID of the PU at index n. M_TU_NAME + n MIL_STRING Returns the name of the TU at index n. M_TU_FID + n MIL_INT Returns the function ID of the TU at index n.   MfpgaCommandInquire Type Description M_NUMBER_OF_INPUTS MIL_INT Returns the number of stream input ports. M_NUMBER_OF_OUTPUTS MIL_INT Returns the number of stream output ports. M_PORT_NAME + M_INPUTn MIL_STRING Returns the name (as a string) of the nth stream input port. M_PORT_NAME + M_OUTPUTn MIL_STRING Returns the name (as a string) of the nth stream output port.   1.5.6         Software bug fixes and changes ?         Changed PoCXP camera start-up time, in which over-currents are tolerated, from 32ms to 256ms. ?         Changed on-board default buffer pitch from 64 bytes to 128 bytes. ?         Fixed issue when using data latch with boards that have more than 4GB of memory. ?         Fixed buffer allocation with cameras reporting mono10p pixel format. 1.6         What?s new in MIL 10 Update 75 ?         This is the first release of the Matrox Rapixo CXP. 1.6.1        Standards compliance Matrox Rapixo CXP supports the following standards: ?         JIIA CoaXPress? Standard version 1.0 and 1.1.1. ?         GenICamTM Standard Version 3.1.0 ?         GenICamTM Standard Feature Naming Convention (SFNC) Version 2.0 ?         GenICamTM  GenTL Standard version 1.5 producer: ?  System, Interface, and Device modules are supported. ?  Data Stream and Buffer modules are not supported. 1.6.2        Known limitations and particularities ?         Installing this update removes Matrox Intellicam?s support for the Matrox CronosPlus, Matrox Vio, and IEEE 1394 IIDC devices. ?         Building the MIL examples using Visual Studio 2015 or 2017 also requires the presence of Windows SDK version 8.1, which is installed from the Visual Studio setup. ?         The Bayer conversion hardware supports a maximum line width of 8196 bytes. 2.     Supported operating system ?? Windows 10 64-bit Version 1809, 21H2 and 22H2. ?? Windows 11 64-bit Version 21H2 and 22H2.   3.     Location of examples (in the help file) In the help file, the location information written at the top of examples might not be up-to-date. Use MIL Example Launcher to find an example on disk.
